metadata.titel_preek: Three Days That Changed The World

locutie.beschrijving: The sermon recounts the historical and theological significance of the death, burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ, framed through three specific days.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses 1 Cor 15 as a springboard but relies heavily on historical anecdotes (Spurgeon, Dale, Wolfe) and systematic theories of atonement rather than verse-by-verse exegesis.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher intends to testify to the reality of the resurrection and to move the audience from historical knowledge to personal assurance.
voorbeelden: I want to talk this evening about Three Days That Changed the World.
I shall declare to them, Christ lives!
He took a lick that was meant for me.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel the weight of the atonement and the triumph of the resurrection, leading to a renewed sense of hope and personal certainty.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is mentioned in the Spurgeon quote regarding Joel, but the preacher does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's current work in the preaching event.

voorbeelden: Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures.
There are days that alter the course of things.
The cross forever reveals the wickedness of men.
I know that he got under a load that I was meant to carry.
I shall salute angels... with the glorious words.

commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The commissives are mostly the preacher binding himself to a future action, rather than God binding Himself to the hearer.

voorbeelden: I am now a child of the royal house.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher declares his own status but rarely addresses the hearer with 'I declare to you'.

indicatoren: Talking about Spurgeon talking about preaching.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of history and theology rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer hears that 'Christ lives' but is not explicitly told 'Christ lives for you today'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The 'toezegging' is replaced by the preacher's personal testimony.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Highly dominant. The preacher focuses on his own experience, his own study, and his own future death.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used mostly for rhetorical questions or general 'you' (e.g., 'if you are a tourist').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low. Rarely used to deliver a promise.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Dominates the first half (history and theories).

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Christ lives' refrain at the end.

voorbeelden: The preacher explains theories of atonement and then says 'I know... he made it all right with my soul'.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The move to the hearer is bypassed by the preacher's own subjectivity.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Missing the Commissive/Declarative link to the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The indicative is 'Christ lives', but the imperative is a vague 'let every tyrant know'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a powerful personal testimony (Expressive) and a historical lecture (Assertive), but fails to function as a sacramental event for the listener.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Morning begins to draw a thin pencil of light...

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: he made it all right with my soul.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher is the beneficiary, the hearer is an observer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' in terms of rhetorical passion, but not in terms of illocutionary address to the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon 'talks about' the sacrament of the Word but does not 'perform' it for the audience.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. The preacher is the primary speaker talking about God.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. He speaks more as a witness than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I want to talk this evening...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly assumed but not structurally integrated.
tekstueel_bewijs: I will pour out my spirit...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The preacher treats the Resurrection as a fact to be believed, not the sermon as a means of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Only in the poetic description of the third day.
tekstueel_bewijs: The strong Son of God shakes himself.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 1st person singular (I) and 3rd person (He) to 2nd person (You) with performative verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: He made it all right with my soul.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: By His cross, He makes it all right with your soul today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from testimony to declarative grace.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is locked in the preacher's past experience.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'Christ lives' refrain to address the hearer's specific fears.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He lives, I promise you that your sins are gone.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Replace historical anecdotes with direct address.
voorbeeldzinnen: You who are sitting here, Christ rose for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative is missing a personal foundation.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the call to 'know' on the declaration of 'forgiveness'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and poetically moving, but it remains a 'report' on the Resurrection. To become an 'event,' it must turn the 'He' and 'I' into a 'He for You'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (which is high here). SAT reveals this as a weakness that obscures the 'Declarative' act of God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the 'Christ lives' climax is powerful. Illocutionarily, it is still an Assertive (stating a fact) rather than a Commissive (God's promise to the hearer).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the preacher's personal 'knowing' does not automatically translate into the hearer's 'receiving' unless the illocutionary force is directed outward.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus' where history and personal testimony crowd out the sacramental 'Toezegging'.
